items.content_html:
IDBEnvironment and IDBVersionChangeRequest are:

  • non-standard
  • not implemented (nothing in bcdâ€¦)
  • not documented.

This PR removes them from the IndexedDB sidebar.
items.title: Fix IndexedDB sidebar

items.content_html:
Last Q3, in #8379, @sideshowbarker cleaned a lot of existing standard file-related APIs. This was a huge improvement on what we had until then.

We still have a problem with non-standard entries that are intertwined with them, as well as with a sidebar that describes the non-standard version but is also, sometimes, used for the modern APIs.

This PR aims to fix this (there will be still work to bring the actual content of the modern APIs to completion, but this is a huge improvement already, so it is worth limiting us to this.

This is what has been done here:

  • Removed FileExceptionthat was Chrome-only, behind a prefix, and deleted in Chrome 29. It is now redirected to the File_and_Directory Entries API overview page.
  • Removed LocalFileSystem.* and LocalFileSystemSync.*. I didn't find any mention of it, no bcd. They are now redirected to the File_and_Directory Entries API overview page.
  • Metadata is implemented in Chromium, but is no more part of the File and Directory Entries API. I'm using this sidebar now without adding Metadata to it. Metadata will be accessible (via the non-standard and documented FileSystemEntry.getMetadata() method), but not discoverable (as no more on the standard track and not interoperable, this is good). I also cleaned the spec text and the intro note.
  • Firefox had three API, FileRequest, LockedFile and FileHandle. They are no more on the standard track and have been renamed to IDBFileEvent, IDBFileHandle, and IDBMutableHandle. I moved the page and updated them (events for example). I added a clear note pointing to use File and Directory Entries API. Note that IDBFileRequest is the last interface implementing DOMRequest that we deleted from MDN long ago. I have not resurrected it, but have explained the then() method in IDBFileRequest.
  • The non-standard IDBMutableFile.getFile() has been removed in Firefox 74. I deleted the page and its mention. It is now a Redirect.
  • I removed all mentions about File System API that was mixing both old and new versions of the API.
  • I made sure that all relevant pages are using the File and Directory Entries API sidebar.
  • I deleted the File System API entry from GroupData.json as it is no more used.
  • I deleted the File Handle API overview page as this API is gone (It is a redirect to the modern _File and Directory Entries API` overview page now.
  • Cleaned a lot of things...

There are a lot of improvements to do in the different APIs, but I think we have a good structure now and fewer skeletons in the closet (this is also removing about 100 flaws...)
items.title: Fix non-standard File System related API

items.content_html:
FF101 adds proper parsing for AV1 video codecs in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1757861#c9.

What this means is that you can call these methods HTMLMediaElement.canPlayType(), MediaCapabilities.decodingInfo() and MediaSource.isTypeSupported() passing in a string with mime type and a codec parameter to see if the media type is supported. For AV1 this will now work properly.

The main part specifically for FF101 was a release note, an update to the codec parameter to match the spec, and cross linking to that doc from the places where the codec may be set.

In addition, since I was here, I deleted and redirected all the dictionaries for the different configuration types.
items.title: FF101 AV1 codecs parsing

items.content_html:
Summary

The current example text makes it sound like, in a situation where there were multiple sibling elements of different types, the second list element would be selected; when actually, if there were multiple types of elements at the same level and the second one was not a <li>, then nothing would be selected. I attempted to make the comment in the example more accurate in respect to this, and added a note on the point below.

This is a subtle, but potentially frustrating if misunderstood, aspect of :nth-child(). I'm not actually sure that this is even sufficient; one could potentially include a full example with an interactive code snippet. However, that might be overemphasizing the point, and I don't know how to include interactive code snippets! ðŸ˜… I think that this at least puts the idea in the careful reader's head.

If you feel a full interactive code example would be warranted, please feel free to include one, or direct me to an example I can follow and I can try to do it.

Motivation

Honestly, I had a bug due to this misunderstanding, consulted the MDN docs, and concluded that my initial understanding was correct, as they seemed to support it. (i.e., That only elements of the same type were included in the child count.) Having learned that I was not correct, I'd like to correct the MDN docs so that future readers won't have the same issue.

Supporting details

Here's a codepen demonstrating the behavior:
https://codepen.io/runawaytrike/pen/LYQpqjq

Related issues

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Improving accuracy of `:nth-child()` example text

items.content_html:
This is a uniformization of the different constructors.

  • I removed the mention of the dictionary for the options parameters
  • I renamed the options parameters that were not called options, this makes the pages easier to read (options is simpler than thisNameOfEventInit and consistent all over the place.
  • I uniformized the description of the type parameter, noting that it is case-sensitive and listing the values that browsers will set this to.
  • Some options parameters (and their content) are optional, others not. I checked with the specs and fixed this to be correct (there were quite a few errors).
  • Uniformized how parameters inside options are described.
  • Removed entries below options if they are on Event(). Added a sentence to look there for them.
  • Following what is in BCD, I marked/unmarked pages to be experimental (or others).
  • Indicated when an event created by a constructor is not trusted.
  • Some rephrasing, especially a newly created -> a new.

There are some drive-by fixes (Sidebar fixes, experimental tag on other pages)

It was a bit of a rabbit hole, but I think the result is pretty good. These pages are much more coherent, cleaner, and easier to read.
items.title: Update Event constructors

Summary

  • Fix a link in tabs.onUpdated() page
  • Explain favIconUrl behavior when a page has no favicon

Motivation

Makes clear to developers what to expect of favIconUrl property in both changeInfo parameter of the tabs.onUpdated callback and tabs.Tab, so that they can take into account when a tab loses its favicon (e.g. when navigating from a page that has a favicon to one that doesnâ€™t).

Supporting details

items.content_html:
Summary

One-word change at line 81: "... construct different absolute URLs ..." to "... construct different relative URLs ...".

Motivation

I was reading through the docs and this seemed odd. The instructions say to specify an absolute URL and warn that if you specify a relative URL, "different browsers may construct different absolute URLs"? I think it's supposed to be "different browsers may construct different relative URLs", based on the wording and context alone.

I don't know if browsers construct different absolute URLs or relative URLs, so I might be wrong! It just seems weird from a linguistic perspective.

Supporting details

It seems that the cbe151a initial commit already had this issue.

Related issues

Unknown.

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Changed `different absolute` to `different relative`

items.content_html:
The stack trace is added (if it is) to the object returned by the constructor, not when the object is thrown. This was incorrect in a number of places. Fixed now.

Thanks very much @eqrion
items.title: WebAssembly:Exception - fix confusion around when stack is added to exceptions

The docs appear to match the spec and have reasonable examples etc.

Other docs work for this can be tracked in #15469

items.content_html:
** do not merge until all Manifest V3 content is ready **

Summary

Changes to the manifest keys for Manifest V3 support in the developer preview, including:

  • update to the keys list on the overview page to add details of supported manifest versions
  • addition of a "Manifest version" line into the overview table of every manifest key page
  • addition of the action key (as a copy of the browser_action key) with cross-reference information between the two
  • update to favicon_url of the chrome_settings_overrides manifest key that a local URL must be provided in MV3.
